ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: LIBRARY=libref] 
          
Name of the physical library for which the secured metadata-bound library is created and the security 
information is stored. 

If the LIBRARY= option is not specified, the physical library from the AUTHLIB procedure is used.

Restriction: The physical library specified cannot be a concatenated library, temporary library, 
or accessed through a SAS/SHARE server and must be processed by an engine that supports metadata-bound libraries.
Suppresses the file not found error message when a data set in a TABLES statement does not exist.

Syntax: PWREQ= YES | NO] 
      
Controls the pop up of a dialog box for a data set password in interactive mode. 

YES
specifies that a dialog box appear if a missing or an invalid password is entered when required. 

NO
prevents a dialog box from appearing. If a missing or invalid password is entered, the data set 
is not opened, and an error message is written to the SAS log.

Default: PWREQ=NO

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that a dialog box appear if a missing or an invalid password is entered when required.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Prevents a dialog box from appearing. If a missing or invalid password is entered, the data set  is not opened, and an error message is written to the SAS log.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: CREATE <option(s)>; 
      
Binds a physical library and data sets in the library to metadata by generating corresponding 
metadata objects in the SAS Metadata Repository and creating a record of the metadata objects 
in the physical directory and data sets. 

Requirement: The AUTHLIB CREATE statement requires a connection to the target metadata server.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: SECUREDLIBRARY='secured-library-name'] 
          
Names the secured library object in the SAS Metadata Server. 

Restriction: The total length of the secured library object pathname including the fully qualified 
secured folder path cannot exceed 256 characters.

[Syntax: PW=all-password </ new-all-password>] 
          
Sets a single password for a metadata-bound library.

[Syntax: ALTER=alter-password </ new-alter-password>] 
          
Sets one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

[Syntax: READ=read-password </ new-read-password>] 
          
Sets one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

[Syntax: WRITE=write-password </ new-write-password>] 
          
Sets one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library. 

TIP: All password values must be valid SAS names with a maximum length of 8 characters.

[Syntax: SECUREDFOLDER='secured-folder-path'] 
          
Is the name of the metadata folder within the /System/Secured Libraries folder tree where the 
secured library object will be created. 

If the SECUREDFOLDER= option is not specified, the metadata-bound library is created directly 
in the /System/Secured Libraries folder of the Foundation repository. If the SECUREDFOLDER= 
option does not begin with a slash (/), it is a relative path and the value will be appended 
to /System/Secured Libraries/ to find the folder. If the SECUREDFOLDER= option begins with a 
slash (/), it is an absolute path and the value must begin with /System/Secured Libraries or 
/<repository_name>/System/Secured Libraries. 

Restriction: The total length of the secured library object pathname including the fully 
qualified secured folder path cannot exceed 256 characters.

[Syntax: ENCRYPT=YES | NO | AES] 
          
Specifies the encryption type.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) encryption and to record the key in metadata.  Requirement: ENCRYPTKEY= option is required if the library has AES encryption.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ENCRYPTKEY=key-value </ key-value>] 
          
Specifies a key value for AES encryption.

Requirement:
ENCRYPTKEY= option is required if the library or a data file has AES encryption. 

Tip:
The encryption key value for all the data sets in a library can be stored in a metadata-bound library 
so that an authorized user does not have to supply the encryption key value every time a data set is opened.

[Syntax: LIBRARY=libref] 
          
Name of the physical library for which the metadata-bound library is created and the security 
information is stored. 

If the LIBRARY= option is not specified, the physical library from the AUTHLIB procedure is used.

Restriction: The physical library specified cannot be a concatenated library, temporary library, 
or accessed through a SAS/SHARE server and must be processed by an engine that supports metadata-bound libraries.

[Syntax: REQUIRE_ENCRYPTION=YES | NO]

YES
Specifies that all data sets in a metadata-bound library are automatically encrypted.

NO
Specifies that data sets in a metadata-bound library are not automatically encrypted.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies that all data sets in a metadata-bound library are automatically encrypted.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Specifies that data sets in a metadata-bound library are not automatically encrypted.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: TABLESONLY=YES | NO] 
          
Specifies whether the MODIFY statement action is applied at the library level or just to the tables. 
If TABLESONLY=NO, the action is applied to the library and data sets. If TABLESONLY=YES, the action 
is applied only to the data sets.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The action is applied only to the data sets.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The action is applied to the library and data sets.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: REMOVE <option(s)>;
      
Removes the physical security information and metadata objects that protect a metadata-bound 
library so that it is no longer a metadata-bound library. 

Requirement: The AUTHLIB REMOVE statement requires a connection to the target metadata server. 

Note: If any data set is encrypted with passwords, you cannot remove passwords unless you also 
specify ENCRYPT=NO to remove encryption. 

Tip: Before you use the REMOVE statement, consider running the REPORT statement. The output 
from the REPORT statement identifies any physical tables that do not have corresponding secured 
table objects in metadata. In the unusual circumstance that such physical tables exist, their 
security location information is unaffected by the REMOVE statement unless you specify AUTHADMIN=YES 
in the LIBNAME statement. You should use the AUTHADMIN=YES option in the LIBNAME statement in 
this circumstance.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PW=all-password </ new-all-password>] 
          
Specifies a single password for a metadata-bound library.

[Syntax: ALTER=alter-password </ new-alter-password>] 
          
Specifies one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

[Syntax: READ=read-password </ new-read-password>] 
          
Specifies one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

[Syntax: WRITE=write-password </ new-write-password>]  
          
Specifies one of a maximum of three password values for a metadata-bound library.

[Syntax: ENCRYPT=YES | NO | AES] 
          
Specifies the encryption type.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) encryption and to record the key in metadata.  Requirement: ENCRYPTKEY= option is required if the library has AES encryption.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ENCRYPTKEY=key-value </ key-value>] 
          
Specifies a key value for AES encryption.

Requirement:
ENCRYPTKEY= option is required if the library or a data file has AES encryption. 

Tip:
The encryption key value for all the data sets in a library can be stored in a metadata-bound library 
so that an authorized user does not have to supply the encryption key value every time a data set is opened.

[Syntax: LIBRARY=libref] 
          
Name of the physical library for which the metadata-bound library is created and the security 
information is stored. 

If the LIBRARY= option is not specified, the physical library from the AUTHLIB procedure is used.

Restriction: The physical library specified cannot be a concatenated library, temporary library, 
or accessed through a SAS/SHARE server and must be processed by an engine that supports metadata-bound 
libraries.

[Syntax: TABLESONLY=YES | NO] 
          
Specifies whether the REMOVE statement action is applied at the library level or just to the tables. 
If TABLESONLY=NO, the action is applied to the library and data sets. If TABLESONLY=YES, the action 
is applied only to the data sets.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The action is applied only to the data sets.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The action is applied to the library and data sets.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
One of three REPAIR actions: ADD | UPDATE | DELETE
          
One of these actions must be specified.

One of three REPAIR actions: ADD | UPDATE | DELETE
          
One of these actions must be specified.

One of three REPAIR actions: ADD | UPDATE | DELETE
          
One of these actions must be specified.
Clarifies that the REPAIR action is to apply to the physical security information in the file system.
Clarifies that the REPAIR action is to apply to the metadata objects in the SAS Metadata Server.

[Syntax: PW=all-password </ new-all-password>] 
          
Specifies a single password for a metadata-bound library.

[Syntax: ALTER=alter-password </ new-alter-password>] 
          
Assigns, changes, or removes an Alter password from the secured library object and from the data sets 
in the physical library.

[Syntax: READ=read-password </ new-read-password>] 
          
Assigns, changes, or removes a Read password from the secured library object and from the data sets 
in the physical library.

[Syntax: WRITE=write-password </ new-write-password>] 
          
Assigns, changes, or removes a Write password from the secured library object and from the data sets 
in the physical library.

[Syntax: ENCRYPTKEY=key-value </ key-value>] 
          
Specifies a key value for AES encryption.

Requirement:
ENCRYPTKEY= option is required if the library or a data file has AES encryption. 

Tip:
The encryption key value for all the data sets in a library can be stored in a metadata-bound library 
so that an authorized user does not have to supply the encryption key value every time a data set is opened.

[Syntax: LIBRARY=libref] 
          
Name of the physical library where the security information is stored. 

If the LIBRARY= option is not specified, the physical library from the AUTHLIB procedure is used.

Restriction: The physical library specified cannot be a concatenated library, temporary library, 
or accessed through a SAS/SHARE server and must be processed by an engine that supports metadata-bound libraries.

[Syntax: SECUREDLIBRARY='secured-library-name'] 
          
Names the secured library object in the SAS Metadata Server. 

Restriction: The total length of the secured library object pathname including the fully qualified 
secured folder path cannot exceed 256 characters.

[Syntax: SECUREDFOLDER='secured-folder-path'] 
          
Is the name of the metadata folder within the /System/Secured Libraries folder tree where the 
secured library object will be repaired or re-created. 

Restriction: The total length of the secured library object pathname including the fully 
qualified secured folder path cannot exceed 256 characters.

[Syntax: SECUREDLIBRARYGUID=secured-library-guid] 
          
External identity assigned to the secured library object and stored as part of the security 
information in the physical library. 

Note:The secured library GUID can be found in the REPORT statement output. The GUID that 
is stored as an external ID in the metadata is not reported, but it matches when correctly 
configured.

[Syntax: TABLESONLY=YES | NO] 
          
Specifies whether the REPAIR statement action is applied at the library level or just to the tables. 
If TABLESONLY=NO, the action is applied to the library and the tables. If TABLESONLY=YES, the action 
is applied only to the tables. 

Default: NO 

Tip: If you specify TABLESONLY=YES and a new password value for a password option, the new password 
value is ignored. The current password value is still required if the library is metadata-bound.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The action is applied only to the tables.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: The action is applied to the library and the tables.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: REPORT <LIBRARY=libref>; 
      
For a specified metadata-bound library, compares physical library contents with corresponding 
metadata objects (in order to identify any inconsistencies). 

Requirement: The AUTHLIB REPORT statement requires a connection to the target metadata server.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: LIBRARY=libref] 
          
Name of the physical library where the metadata-bound library is created and the metadata security 
information is stored. 

If the LIBRARY= option is not specified, the physical library from the AUTHLIB procedure is used.

Restriction: The physical library specified cannot be a concatenated library, temporary library, 
or accessed through a SAS/SHARE server and must be processed by an engine that supports metadata-bound libraries.

[Syntax: ENCRYPTKEY=key-value </ key-value>] 
          
Specifies a key value for AES encryption.

Requirement:
ENCRYPTKEY= option is required if the library or a data file has AES encryption. 

Tip:
The encryption key value for all the data sets in a library can be stored in a metadata-bound library 
so that an authorized user does not have to supply the encryption key value every time a data set is opened.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: TABLES SAS-dataset(s) | _ALL_ | _NONE_ </ option(s)>; 
      
Used after a CREATE, MODIFY, REMOVE, REPAIR, and REPORT statement to specify the tables to process 
a statement action. Also, you can specify the current passwords or encrypt key value of the data 
sets in the TABLES statement, if different from the metadata-bound library passwords. 

Default: When no TABLES statement is specified, the TABLES _ALL_ statement is the default behavior. 

Requirement: The TABLES statement can follow only a CREATE, MODIFY, REMOVE, REPAIR, or REPORT statement.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies password options to apply to all data sets.

Limits the action of the previous CREATE, MODIFY, or REPAIR statements to the library level and 
does not apply the action to any table.

[Syntax: ENCRYPT=YES | NO | AES] 
          
Specifies the encryption type.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Specifies Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) encryption and to record the key in metadata.  Requirement: ENCRYPTKEY= option is required if the library has AES encryption.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ENCRYPTKEY=key-value </ key-value>] 
          
Specifies a key value for AES encryption.

Requirement:
ENCRYPTKEY= option is required if the library or a data file has AES encryption. 

Tip:
The encryption key value for all the data sets in a library can be stored in a metadata-bound library 
so that an authorized user does not have to supply the encryption key value every time a data set is opened.

[Syntax: MEMTYPE= DATA | VIEW] 
          
Restricts processing to a single member type of DATA or VIEW. If not specified, the default is both types. 

DATA
  specifies SAS data file member type.
VIEW
  specifies SAS view member type.

Default: ALL

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Specifies SAS data file member type.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PW=all-password </ new-all-password>] 
          
Specifies the current password of the data set.

[Syntax: ALTER=alter-password </ new-alter-password>] 
          
Specifies the current ALTER= password of the data set.

[Syntax: READ=read-password </ new-read-password>] 
          
Specifies the current READ= password of the data set.

[Syntax: WRITE=write-password </ new-write-password>] 
          
Specifies the current WRITE= password of the data set. 

TIP: All password values must be valid SAS names with a maximum length of 8 characters.

[Syntax: SECUREDTABLEGUID=secured-table-guid] 
          
The external identity of the secured table object that was assigned when the object was created. 
It is stored as part of the location information in physical data sets that are bound to the secured 
table object.
